title: Can I get an annulment while deployed?
question: I got married 2 months before I deployed to Iraq. Me and my wife broke up a month ago, and I want to get as much taken care of before I come home in 3 months. is there any way to get an annulment while I'm here?
question_tags: Divorce,Annulment of marriage,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
I'm sorry that things didn't work out for you.

Unlike a divorce, you can't get an annulment just because you haven't been married very long, and you don't like being married. You can only get an annulment for one of a fairly specific list of reasons, and getting an annulment, even if you're entitled to one, is a more complicated process than dissolving the marriage.

If you and your wife agree to dissolve the marriage, have limited assets and debts, and no children of the marriage, you may qualify for a "Summary Dissolution", which is intended to be a simple "do-it-yourself without a lawyer" dissolution (divorce). The instructions and forms are available online (see below) or at your local courthouse.

Good luck, and thank you for your service to our country.
